input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is HPSEActor

1. Creates a storage volume with the specified storage pool and the storage setting ID. Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>create</command> <category>volume</category> <process-id>create-storage-volume</process-id> <command-arguments> <pool-id>1001</pool-id> <size>10</size> <storage-setting-id>1</storage-setting-id> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. pool-id[Required] identifier for a storage system pool storage-setting-id[Optional] identifier for the storage setting. Default value is "-default" size[Required] size of the volume in megabytes
2. Creates a storage volume on the specified storage pool with the storage settings ID and name.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>create</command> <category>volume</category> <process-id>create-storage-volume</process-id> <command-arguments> <pool-id>1001</pool-id> <size>10</size> <storage-setting-id>1</storage-setting-id> <name>volumename</name> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. pool-id[Required] identifier for a storage system pool storage-setting-id[Optional] identifier for the storage setting. Default value is "-default" size[Required] size of the volume in megabytes name[required] name of the storage volume you want to create.
3. Creates a storage volume on an LSI storage system.
Sample Request XML: <items> <item> <command>create</command> <category>volume</category> <process-id>create-storage-volume</process-id> <command-arguments> <pool-id>1001</pool-id> <cacheahead>10</cacheahead> <segmentsize>10</segmentsize> <storage-setting-id>1</storage-setting-id> <lsi/> <size>10</size> <name>Test</name> </command-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameters Description:
command[Required] The actual command type that will be executed. category[Required] This parameter identifies the top-level functional category. process-id[Required] Unique identifier for the process workflow. lsi[Required] Indicates that volume is created on a LSI storage system pool-id[Required] identifier for a storage system pool storage-setting-id[Optional] identifier for the storage setting. Default value is "-default" size[Required] size of the volume in megabytes name[Optional] name of the storage volume you want to create. segmentsize[Required] segment size of the volume cacheahead[Required] cache read-ahead multiplier (0 to 65535 bytes). A cache read-ahead multiplier copies additional data blocks into the cache while it is reading and copying host-requested data blocks from disk to cache. Select the multiplier that maximizes performance for the way the volume will be utilized.

documentation.description:
This wrapper supports the following requirements:-
1. Creates a storage volume with the specified storage pool and the storage setting ID. 2. Creates a storage volume on the specified storage pool with the storage settings ID and name. 3. Creates a storage volume on an LSI storage system.
